main.description: Official Tupaia website - Open source health information system for Pacific Island nations

ProductOverview.Summary: Tupaia is an open-source health information system specifically designed for Pacific Island nations to support health data collection, analysis, and reporting.
ProductOverview.Description: Tupaia provides tools for health facility management, patient data collection, clinical decision support, and health system monitoring. It is designed to work in challenging environments with limited connectivity and infrastructure, making it suitable for remote and island communities.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality: Health information system for Pacific Island nations with offline capabilities
ProductOverview.Users: Healthcare providers, health administrators, and public health officials in Pacific Island nations

Reach.SummaryOfReach: Tupaia has been implemented in multiple Pacific Island nations to support health information management and improve healthcare delivery in remote communities.

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: Tupaia is developed and maintained by Beyond Essential Systems with support from the Pacific Island health community.

HostAnchorOrganization.name: Beyond Essential Systems
HostAnchorOrganization.description: Health technology company focused on Pacific Island nations

Sustainability.Description: Tupaia is supported through open source development and community contributions.
